content:
Diagnosis:
Mixed neuroendocrine carcinoma of breast with extensive liver metastases

Staging:
T3N2 (15/16 nodes positive) M1, Grade 3
ER/PR positive, HER2 positive, Ki67 80%

Previous Treatment:
Completed 6 cycles carboplatin/etoposide March-August 2023
Partial response initially but subsequent progression

Current Situation:
Progressive disease in liver with new lesions
CT 15 April 2024 shows increase in size and number of liver metastases
Largest lesion segment 7 increased from 3.2cm to 5.1cm
New lesions in segments 4 and 8

Clinical Assessment:
Performance status deteriorated to ECOG 2
Increasing right upper quadrant pain requiring opioid escalation
New onset peripheral edema
LFTs show rising pattern - bilirubin 45, ALT 156, ALP 345

MDT Discussion 18 April 2024:
Recommendation for switch to capecitabine/temozolomide regime
Consider referral to Phase 1 unit if further progression

Plan:
Commence capecitabine/temozolomide regime today
Dose reduction to 75% due to performance status
Urgent referral to palliative care for symptom management
Repeat imaging after 2 cycles
Weekly LFT monitoring
